intro: Ogcodeia tessmannii, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with small, oval-shaped leaves. Its unique floral structure and native habitat make it a subject of interest in botanical studies. Ogcodeia tessmannii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
